text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Siddhartha Gautama

text: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.
author: Siddhartha Gautama

text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Siddhartha Gautama

text: Purity or impurity depends on oneself; no one can purify another.
author: Siddhartha Gautama

text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
author: Siddhartha Gautama

text: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
author: Siddhartha Gautama

text: You have power over your mind—not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Laozi

text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Laozi

text: Silence is a source of great strength.
author: Laozi

text: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
author: Laozi

text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
author: Laozi

text: The wise man does not lay up his own treasures. The more he gives to others, the more he has for his own.
author: Laozi

text: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom.
author: Laozi

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

text: Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart.
author: Confucius

text: Silence is a true friend who never betrays.
author: Confucius

text: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
author: Confucius

text: The great man is he who does not lose his child's-heart.
author: Mencius

text: If the scholar has not the spirit of a gentleman, he is no better than a common man.
author: Mencius

text: Benevolence is the heart of man, and righteousness is his path.
author: Mencius

text: He who outrages benevolence is called a robber; he who outrages righteousness is called a ruffian.
author: Mencius

text: There is no greater delight than to be conscious of sincerity on self-examination.
author: Mencius

text: Human nature is good, just as water naturally flows downhill.
author: Mencius

text: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.
author: Sun Tzu

text: In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Know yourself and know your enemy, and you will never be defeated.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Great results can be achieved with small forces.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Strategy without tactics is the slowest route to victory. Tactics without strategy is the noise before defeat.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.
author: Sun Tzu

text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
author: Epictetus

text: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
author: Epictetus

text: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
author: Epictetus

text: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
author: Epictetus

text: Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems.
author: Epictetus

text: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus

text: First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.
author: Epictetus

text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

text: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
author: Seneca

text: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
author: Seneca

text: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
author: Seneca

text: If a man knows not which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
author: Seneca

text: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.
author: Seneca

text: The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately.
author: Seneca

text: Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.
author: Zhuangzi

text: The fish trap exists for the fish. Once you've gotten the fish, you can forget the trap.
author: Zhuangzi

text: Flow with whatever may happen, and let your mind be free.
author: Zhuangzi

text: Rewards and punishment is the lowest form of education.
author: Zhuangzi

text: To a mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.
author: Zhuangzi

text: Easy is right. Begin right and you are easy. Keep easy and you are right.
author: Zhuangzi

text: All men are my children. I desire that they may be provided with all the welfare and happiness of this world.
author: Ashoka the Great

text: No society can prosper if it is not at peace with itself.
author: Ashoka the Great

text: The greatest victory is the victory of Dharma.
author: Ashoka the Great

text: One should honor others' religions, for doing so strengthens one's own and helps others' as well.
author: Ashoka the Great

text: Everywhere, each person should be kind to one another.
author: Ashoka the Great

text: In the happiness of his subjects lies the king's happiness; in their welfare his welfare.
author: Ashoka the Great

text: The nature of man is evil; his goodness is only acquired training.
author: Xunzi

text: If there is no toil, there will be no ease; if there is no hard work, there will be no glory.
author: Xunzi

text: Learning should never cease.
author: Xunzi

text: The petty man is eager to make excuses for his vices; the superior man is eager to reform.
author: Xunzi

text: A man’s character is built by his actions, not by his intentions.
author: Xunzi

text: Without a clear focus, there can be no great achievement.
author: Xunzi

text: To one who has faith, no explanation is necessary. To one without faith, no explanation is possible.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: The things that we love tell us what we are.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: Fear is such a powerful emotion for humans that when we allow it to take us over, it drives out our compassion.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: Distinctions are made by the mind, but things are what they are.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: Better to illuminate than merely to shine, to deliver to others contemplated truths than merely to contemplate.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: If the highest aim of a captain were to preserve his ship, he would keep it in port forever.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: Reason in man is rather like God in the world.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: An eye for an eye will only make the whole world blind.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: My life is my message.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: God, grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, courage to change the things I can, and wisdom to know the difference.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

text: Man's capacity for justice makes democracy possible; but man's inclination to injustice makes democracy necessary.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

text: Nothing that is worth doing can be achieved in our lifetime; therefore we must be saved by hope.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

text: Humility is the virtue by which we recognize our own limitations.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

text: Self-deception is the most common form of human folly.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

text: We are all prisoners of our own perspectives.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

text: Forgiveness is the final form of love.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

text: Whatever you are, be a good one.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: I am a slow walker, but I never walk back.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: I do the very best I know how - the very best I can; and I mean to keep doing so until the end.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Am I not destroying my enemies when I make friends of them?
author: Abraham Lincoln
